source.author: Duretto, M.F.
source.title: Rutaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Duretto, M.F. (1999). Rutaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Calyx glabrescent, green; rare, in far east
Leaves broadly ovate to cordate, rounded to truncate at base
Leaves elliptic to ovate, cuneate at base
Calyx 4–5 mm long, margins undulate or dentate
Calyx 4–7 mm long, with prominent linear lobes to 3 mm long
Corolla cream to yellow-brown, 1.5–2.5 cm long; leaves coriaceous, to 4 cm long; flowers solitary, axillary
Corolla greenish-yellow or reddish-mauve, 2–3 cm long; leaves papery, usually greater than 4 cm long; inflorescence of 1–3 flowers, terminal or axillary
